title: why
body: why does riot insist on prolonging this bulls**t tank meta, which quite literally just ended with the influx of runeglaive junglers, do they not remember the incessant plea's to nerf cinderhulk now they just went and buffed an entire army of tanks with items to boot, there is literally no point in playing any sort of carry you will just get sh*t on by a full tank that outputs more damage than you, which in turn has made the ever dying role of ADC become even more obsolete, and has made us to play these boring team fight controlling long range mid laners constantly, this patch has doubled the amount of unplayable champions

replies.body:
You're meant to be rekt when melees get their hands onto your squishy arse, if you haven't noticed by now.

So either position better so you never get caught, buy actual defense so you won't gg in 1 hit or you know, just play someone who sustains better for a start then gradually move onto the less tanky champs.

Oh shut up with your complaining.

Here's why you're complaining about the "tank meta". You're bad.
Get good.
For like three seasons now ADCs have been stupidly stagnant, buying only a Last Whisper as an off hand whim.
When was the last time you actually played ADC and THOUGHT about your build? Or what you contribute to the team other than just soaking up gold and kills from your teammates?
I'm willing to bet you've NEVER THOUGHT, and you've just mindlessly bought items and thrown yourself into the game.

Well tough luck princess, you now have to actually USE YOUR BRAIN in order to succeed as an ADC.

All adcs do are complain... "oh no I did not get a gank from my jungler" "Support stop feeding" "omfg blitz stop pulling them into me" "report support still feeding" they do not understand that the supports are dieing for them so they can stay and get CS... Witch is why they are called ADD carry... ADDs just brag how good they are and most of the time put down other compinys

But Supports shouldn't be dieing for anyone, they should be minimising death on their team.
